summary: This document is a chain of emails from August 9-10, 2019, primarily involving attorney Bruce Barket. The emails discuss the investigation into Jeffrey Epstein's suicide attempt at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York, a request for a death notification letter to a judge, and instructions not to interview a staff attorney without counsel's permission. The institution is noted as being on lockdown.

persons.name: Bruce Barket
persons.context: Attorney representing a client (likely Jeffrey Epstein) at MCC New York; he requests updates on the investigation into Epstein's suicide attempt and instructs that a staff attorney not be interviewed without his permission.

persons.name: Stephanie Scannell
persons.context: Recipient of an email from Bruce Barket regarding the Epstein investigation; appears to be a point of contact, possibly at the correctional facility or another agency.

persons.name: Nick
persons.context: Referred to by Bruce Barket as someone who should not be interviewed about the incident without Barket's permission; appears to be a Supervisory Staff Attorney at the MCC New York.

connections.description: Bruce Barket, as counsel, instructs that Nick (a Supervisory Staff Attorney) should not be interviewed about the incident without Barket's permission, indicating a protective attorney-client or legal representative relationship.
Bruce Barket communicates with Stephanie Scannell via email regarding the investigation into Epstein's suicide attempt and visiting arrangements.

events.title: Investigation into Epstein Suicide Attempt
events.description: An email indicates an investigation regarding Jeffrey Epstein's suicide attempt is concluding, with no charges or disciplinary actions being filed.

events.title: MCC New York Lockdown
events.description: The Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York is locked down due to an incident that is all over the press, referencing Epstein's death.

events.title: Request for Death Notification Letter
events.description: An associate warden requests a copy of the death notification letter to be sent to the judge.

locations: New York Metropolitan Correctional Center, 150 Park Row, New York, New York 10007
666 Old Country Road, Garden City, NY 11530
keyFacts: The emails are dated August 9-10, 2019, immediately following Jeffrey Epstein's death in custody.
Bruce Barket, an attorney, is actively managing the aftermath, seeking updates on the investigation and protecting a staff attorney from being interviewed.
The Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York was on lockdown due to the incident, which was all over the press.
An investigation into Epstein's suicide attempt had concluded with no charges or disciplinary actions being filed, as of August 9, 2019.
A death notification letter to a judge was requested, indicating formal judicial notification of Epstein's death.
